column4: I have 24 gig unallocated at the beginning of my drive I want to use for /boot and for "/" I already created a new /home and copied my old profile. I have my old extended partition 50 gigs, and a swap 2 gig.  I can only create 1 more primary partition...
so I am kind of stuck.  I don't want to delete my old extended partition just yet, in case I lose critical data
can I delete my swap and still boot without having to tweak any settings?
you should put a comment, an # , in front of the line that contains swap in /etc/fstab.. gksudo gedit /etc/fstab   is the command to be able to edit it
